///Open Document///

OPERATION: A Stealthy Approach

//Briefing//(Skip to Mission Parameters if you want)

Listen up maggots!

Our commanders at K-Nap(Kerfrican National Air Patrol) have discovered that our terrorist counterparts, K-Pan(Kerfrican Patriotic Aerial Navy), have developed a new super weapon, a Booster powerful enough to deorbit Kerbin! We suspect Jeb was the engineer. We need a daredevil flyer to scout K-Pan\'s secret lair, Krowhaven, and lay a beacon to pinpoint the area for orbital bombardment. Unfortunately, K-Pan has just deployed a new radar system. We simply cannot send in a squadron to blitzkrieg the place, as they have a defensive ICSB(Inter-Continental Solid Booster) launch system. We\'re counting on you!

//End Briefing//

//Mission Parameters//

Fly an aircraft and land at Krowhaven base, on the island of Kersica. At any time, you cannot ascend past 200m. Any explosions, whether from crashes, landings or staging, will not be tolerated, unless the explosion occurs on the KSC terrain.

To qualify for this challenge, you must post a picture of you landed on the island, and a Mission Report screenshot showing the maximum altitude and flight events.

You must land on land ???

Mod parts allowed are C7 Aviation, Wobbly Rockets, SIDR&SD, Tuned SAS.

Attached is an example craft, an interpretation of the WWII Fieseler Storch. It requires Tuned SAS and C7. Using it does not count for the challenge.

/MAP/

//End Mission Parameters//

///End Document///
I achieved this with a cross between a space shuttle and a WWII Fieseler Storch. It drops its main engines just after takeoff, and then use air turns to maintain its speed.
Challenge Accepted.

Ah, plane managed to load this time.

OMG IT ACTUALLY FLIES

OK, I\'m most of the way to completing this mission (under KSP 0.11 x1)

Phase 1: Mapping

I intended to fly my fairly-unstable rocket-to-plane orbiter in a ballistic trajectory, land, then get a heading and distance fix.

Boost and trajectory went perfectly fine, despite that particular rocket being quite a challenge to control. The new orbital map view was quite nice for doing some course-correction burns to ensure I came down over the target. Sadly, I am afflicted with the red-textures bug, hence the odd looking rocket stage. Kere I am, coming down over the island.

My normally-working drogue chute ripped off during reentry, but I was able to control my plane well enough and settle into low flight. The small size of this flyer makes it a mite twitchy. Sadly, shortly after the following screenshot was taken, I lost control, went into a spin, and watched as the plane tore itself apart. The mission was satisfactorily accomplished though; I had a decent heading and distance to the island.

Phase 2: Stealthy Approach, first attempt

Based on good results from the mapping expedition, I was confident that my Meridian flyer could make it to the island, in a reasonable amount of time. Nothing to do but set off...

Looking back, you can see KSC swiftly dropping below the horizon.

As it turns out, Meridian is flyable at 2x time acceleration while still keeping a fixed heading and within the altitude window... mostly. I did mess up once and rise to 226 meters, but I think that\'d be easy enough to avoid next time. Passed the headland at about halfway there... fuel consumption is slightly worrisome.

As it turned out, I did have plenty of fuel. Kersica is coming up on the horizon!

Now to just stick the landing...

Catastrophic Failure! Oops.

Upcoming Phase: Second Attempt

The overall mission structure and design of the Meridian is solid, but the lack of good runways in enemy territory is problematic. Work shall be done towards modifying the flyer with a deployable signal flare that can be dropped without needing a full-stop landing. Additionally, though there is ample fuel to reach the distant island, Meridian as it currently stands is not capable of making the full return trip to KSC. For the next mission, after deploying the beacon the plane will fly to the closest point on the mainland. A special crew recovery ejection system will be used to ensure the safty of our brave Kerbal pilots in the absence of a friendly airfield.

Im seeing if the C-119 Flying BoxCar can rise to the Challenge. so far if you set it to cruise at 80m/s it has alright Fuel Economy. i am about 1/5 the way there wooooo . although i doubt the box car will be able to land since it has previously proven rather iffy at landings.

Note: I gave up along the way because i was convinced that if i managed to arrive at Krowehaven. then my landing would be very very noisy. so i am out fitting with with an RSC system purely for landing

on trip two i was halfway with half the amount of Fuel left and i was just about to finish crossing the perilous coastal mountain range when suddenly my aircraft started to drop. i pulled up quickly narrowly missing a mountain spur but stalled in the process. there were no survivors

on Trip Three.

The C-119 flying BoxCar set its sights on the bearing of 45 degrees from true north at a constant 70m/s following the shore the three pilots were determined to reach Krowhaven and due to the inaccuracy of the gps pulled away from the shore line a little early. after 5 minutes of travel Bill convinced Jeb that they had in fact Gone the wrong way. The crew made a slight change and soon saw land ahead. there excitement was soon quelled when bob pointed out that it was not the island of Kersica but rather the mainland. The pilots then readjusted there course and began there journey across the kersican straight.

The Kerbins arrived at Krowhaven Military base Just under 37 minutes. landing proved difficult and was almost completely smooth until the aircraft stumbled upon a rough patch of dirt ripping off the Tail wing and rear fuel Tanks. luckily the transport component of the Aircraft was left intact and the Kerbin Special forces quickly Offloaded. also a design feature of the C-119 Flying BoxCar is that the Large Cargo Component is large enough to fit a M8 GreyHound Armoured Car. (only 32 Troops Were in the in the C-119{the Fat greyhound Bastard took up 30 seats!)) although the Island was quickly taken over and the Huge Booster destroyed. The Explosion from the Landing Alerted Kudam Bin kaden ( the Main conspirator who has a liking to the fashion of Growing a long majestic beard while Draping himself in white Table Clothes) who quickly escaped to his Private submarine Lair which is Shaped a lot like a phallic where he Began Plotting his next evil Plan of getting rid of the kerman Brothers.

Although the weapon was destroyed the escape of the Kudam has deemed this Mission a failure

(looks like i need to Try again ).
